original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid day on Thursday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
“The market is volatile, moving from green to red. Hovering about due to freight costs, which is making the market fluctuate because of Expolanka,” an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was up 0.11 percent or 9.37 points to 8,731.43, the main index S&P SL20 was up 0.21 percent or 5.19 points to 2,469.01.
Top gainers were Browns Investment, NDB Bank and Melstacorp. (Colombo/June08/2023)
